meanings.definition: The process of tracing over live-action film footage to create realistic animation.
meanings.sent1: Rotoscoping requires careful tracing over real-life scenes to make animated characters move.
meanings.sent2: The animator used rotoscoping to turn live-action scenes into animated sequences.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the rotoscoping artist accidentally traced over a flying bird instead of the main character!
meanings.sent4: Her artistic style was like rotoscoping, capturing the essence of reality in every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The magic of rotoscoping brought the hand-drawn characters to life with fluid movements.

meanings.definition: A technique used in filmmaking to create special effects by tracing over live-action footage frame by frame.
meanings.sent1: The special effects team employed rotoscoping to enhance the action scenes in the movie.
meanings.sent2: Rotoscoping was crucial in adding futuristic elements to the live-action footage.
meanings.sent3: During the blooper reel, the rotoscoping process accidentally turned the actors into dancing cartoons!
meanings.sent4: The director's vision was realized through the meticulous use of rotoscoping in post-production.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of rotoscoping lies in its ability to seamlessly blend reality with imagination in films.
